alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Caddo; Canadian; Custer; Dewey; Garfield; Kingfisher; Logan; Major; Noble (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 17 at 9:50PM CDT until June 17 at 10:30PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Kingfisher County in central Oklahoma... Northwestern Caddo County in southwestern Oklahoma... Southwestern Noble County in northern Oklahoma... Custer County in western Oklahoma... Blaine County in northwestern Oklahoma... Northwestern Logan County in central Oklahoma... Dewey County in northwestern Oklahoma... Southern Garfield County in northern Oklahoma... Southeastern Major County in northwestern Oklahoma... Northwestern Canadian County in central Oklahoma... * Until 1030 PM CDT. * At 949 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 3 miles west of Ames to 3 miles north of Eagle City to 5 miles west of Putnam, moving east at 80 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Weatherford, Clinton, Watonga, Kingfisher, Taloga, Hennessey, Crescent, Waukomis, Geary, Okarche, Okeene, Thomas, Hydro, Cashion, Arapaho, Canton, Covington, Calumet, Dover, and Drummond. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect for the warned area.

area.areaDesc: Blaine; Caddo; Canadian; Custer; Dewey; Garfield; Kingfisher; Logan; Major; Noble
